problems.title: Surrounded Regions (Union Find)
problems.description:
You are given an m x n matrix board containing letters 'X' and 'O', capture regions that are surrounded:

Connect: A cell is connected to adjacent cells horizontally or vertically.
Region: To form a region connect every 'O' cell.
Surround: The region is surrounded with 'X' cells if you can connect the region with 'X' cells and none of the region cells are on the edge of the board.

To capture a surrounded region, replace all 'O's with 'X's in-place within the original board.

Input Format:
First line contains two integers m and n (rows and columns).
Next m lines contain n space-separated characters ('X' or 'O') representing the board.

Output Format:
Print the modified board with m lines, each containing n space-separated characters.
problems.examples:
Sample Input 1
4 4
X X X X
X O O X
X X O X
X O X X

Sample Output 1
X X X X
X X X X
X X X X
X O X X

Explanation:
The 'O' cells at positions (1,1), (1,2), and (2,2) are surrounded by 'X' cells and are not on the edge, so they are captured and replaced with 'X'. The 'O' at position (3,1) is on the edge region, so it remains 'O'.

Sample Input 2
1 1
X

Sample Output 2
X

Explanation:
The board has only one cell which is 'X', so it remains unchanged.

testCases.input:
4 4
X X X X
X O O X
X X O X
X O X X
testCases.expectedOutput:
X X X X
X X X X
X X X X
X O X X

testCases.input:
3 3
O O O
O O O
O O O
testCases.expectedOutput:
O O O
O O O
O O O

testCases.input:
3 4
X X X X
X O O X
X X X X
testCases.expectedOutput:
X X X X
X X X X
X X X X

hintsList: Start by identifying all 'O' cells that are on the border or connected to border 'O' cells - these cannot be captured.
Use DFS/BFS from border 'O' cells to mark all connected 'O' cells as safe (temporarily mark them differently).
After marking safe cells, iterate through the board: replace unmarked 'O' with 'X' and restore marked cells back to 'O'.
